FactionDef.label: the army of fetid corpses
FactionDef.description: A gathering of horrible creatures which is an amalgamation of reaminmated rotting human flesh, that was deformed into monstrous proportions. Their origins are shrouded in mysteries, backed-up with many theories pertaining on how they came to be, but one thing's for sure is that these necronoids are a menace to all organic life, leaving behind a sea of corpses, enslaved pieces of meat, and fallen settlements in their wake.

ThingDef.label: fetid parasite
ThingDef.description: Parasitic abomonation that festers on healthy hosts. These parasites are very dangerous, not only are they difficult to hit due to their small stature, they are incredibly nimble and can inflict the necronoid infection in every bite.

ThingDef.label: fetid ghoul
ThingDef.description: A re-animated human corpse that was deformed into an insult to mother nature. The fetid ghoul is an aggressive entity which attacks any humalikes that it can see using its nails and teeth, each of which can inflict the necronoid infection in an open wound. Although very dangerous when fighting it upclose and personal, it can be easily dispatched using a variety of long ranged weapons.

ThingDef.label: bladed ghoul
ThingDef.description: A fetid ghoul that undergone mutation, giving it four bladed claws that can rip through steel and inflict necronoid infection in every strike, and improved anatomy for more mobility and health. It is ill-advised to engage this entity in melee combat, always keep your distance and wear armor with high sharp armor value.

ThingDef.label: fetid brute
ThingDef.description: A fetid ghoul that undergone mutation, where there are tumorous growths appearing in parts of their body. Although these growths are hindering their mobility, it provides the entity increased damage resistance due to the added flesh acting as armor. The fetid brute also possess enough intelligence to use firearms, preferably, they favor the plague spewer, making them an even more dangerous entity to face in battle.

ThingDef.label: fetid soldier
ThingDef.description: A fetid ghoul that undergone mutation, and probably a better mutation than the other fetid ghoul variants. The fetid soldier is well balanced in both mobility and health, and possess the inteligence to wield a variety of weapons that its fetid hands can grab. Although dangerous, it is still the same fetid ghoul that one can easily take down, just expect a lot of cassualties to pile up.

ThingDef.label: hag spider
ThingDef.description: A horrifying beast that haunted the rim for a long time. The hag spider is believed to be a combination of a human and a megaspider, which mutated to be slightly bigger than a thrumbo, possessing absurd mobility, and having infectious scyths in both of its four arms. No one knows why its jaws were loose, but even with loose jaws, it can still rip apart flesh with ease. If you ever see this beast in the distance, YOU NEED TO RUN!!

ThingDef.label: bloated ogre
ThingDef.description: The most gigantic entity to ever walk among the necronoid horde. The bloated ogre has better armor due to the amount of meat covering its entire girth, and can easily tank most damage albeit enough for its necronoid allies to swarm the enemy. Upon death, parasites will burst out of its body as a final act to inflict damage.

ThingDef.label: fetid wolf
ThingDef.description: A necronoid biomass that took on the form of a wolf with monstrous aspects. Fetid wolves are dangerous, they are quick on their feet and can rip apart any prey with their razor sharp teeth, and their danger level increases once they joined as an entire pack. In an event of a fetid wolf attack, stay inside the safety of walls and always have an automatic firearm with you.

ThingDef.label: fetid marine
ThingDef.description: An adaptive variant of the fetid ghoul, which uses a necronoid biomass to develop a full set of power armor. The biomass itself mimicked the same damage resistance as a regular power armor, and undergone a deadly mutation where the flesh became fire proof and generates a sturdy shield bubble that intercepts projectiles. The conception of the fetid marine was meant to face the hardened glitterworld super soldiers, but despite all the upgrades, it is still the same fetid ghoul that can be dispatched by normal means.

ThingDef.label: fetid hulk
ThingDef.description: Considered as the perfect mutation of the fetid ghoul. This hulking behemoth possess partial resilience against physical damage, all while possessing superior mobility and combat capabilites, making them a formidable foe to face in battle.

ThingDef.label: howling spider
ThingDef.description: A distant cousin of the hag spider, which is faster and more deadly than the hag spider. It's blood-curdling howl strikes fear into the hearts of man, and its face causes the target a massive mood debuff the more it drew close. As always, it is not advisable to engage this entity at melee and always keep your distance as much as possible.

ThingDef.label: chupacabra
ThingDef.description: A necronoid biomass that took on the form of mexico's infamous monster. The chupacabra possess the worst damage resistance where all of it are 0, and its health pool is down right pathetic. Although despite its negatives, it's still one of the most dangerous entities to ever exist due to its ability to become invisible, and its ability to deal high damage which is comparable to the hag spiders.\n\nDuring its invisible state, it will become partially invincible, where you need to use any AOE attacks to hinder it, but if you wait for a bit, its invisibility will disappear. Just make sure that it doesn't kill any pawn, otherwise, its invisibility will reset.

ThingDef.label: flesh tyrant
ThingDef.description: A powerful boss entity of the necronoid army. The flesh tyrant mostly engages its target through melee, lifting a heavy flesh cleaver and swinging it haphazardly against unfortunate foes. The flesh tyrant is also fireproof and very duarble entity, where it requires an entire batallion of cataphracts to take down a single flesh tyrant.\n\nAlthough incredibly powerful, it is very weak against cleansing weapons.

ThingDef.label: executioner ghoul
ThingDef.description: A powerful boss entity of the necronoid army. This entity embodies fear and death, where one will feel uncomfortable when they draw near to it, and it can literally chop you to pieces using its executioner's axe.\n\nAlthough incredibly powerful, it is very weak against cleansing weapons.

ThingDef.label: bloodletter ghoul
ThingDef.description: A powerful boss entity of the necronoid army. This entity is the same as the executioner ghoul, but the difference is tha it wears a crimson spike armor which generates a protective shield and grants extra damage resistance. It's sadistic nature futher emphasizes due to its use with the bloodletter mace, where it leaves a sea of blood in its wake.\n\nAlthough incredibly powerful, it is very weak against cleansing weapons.

ThingDef.label: crazed butcher
ThingDef.description: A powerful boss entity of the necronoid army. This entity is known as the forked mutation of the fetid ogre, but it mutated to the point of it exhibiting pig-like traits with violent tendencies. It later worn the butchers robe and started terrorizing settlements after settlements using its steel saw.\n\nAlthough incredibly powerful, it is very weak against cleansing weapons.

ThingDef.label: Wendigo
ThingDef.description: An incredibly dangerous entity to ever walk among the necronoid boss entities. Being incredibly hard to dispatch, its sharp claws are so infectious, that it can overwhelm any being with the necronoid infection in just a few swipes. Thankfully, such an entity is incredibly rare amoung the necronoid horde, but if one were to encounter such a beast, they can either fight as if their life depends on it, or perish over their misfortunate self.
